nodes.bodyText:
Does it suppress the WARNING if you skip the export all-together?
Does this need to be a temporary work-around?  The  WARNING is distracting in the first place, even if WDT is fixed to return non-zero.   Maybe just remove the comment.
If answer to both is yes, the change is as sample as:
[ ! -d ${WDT_MODEL_SECRETS_DIRS} ]  && unset WDT_MODEL_SECRETS_DIRS
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,11 @@ RCU_PASSWORD_CHANGED=5
 SCRIPT_ERROR=255
 
 export WDT_MODEL_SECRETS_DIRS="/weblogic-operator/config-overrides-secrets"
+if [ ! -d ${WDT_MODEL_SECRETS_DIRS} ] ; then
+  # Temporary work around for WDT to avoid non zero return code if the directory doesn't exist
+  mkdir -p /tmp/nosuchdir
+  export WDT_MODEL_SECRETS_DIRS="/tmp/nosuchdir"
+fi

nodes.bodyText: I requested a fix on WDT to make it INFO instead of WARNING and remove the default weblogic-operator/config-overrides-secrets  Once WDT fixes and release, we shouldn't need this all together.
